name: The 'Glass House'
description: Lots of good information from friendly (generally) multi-lingual staff. Small bar situated right next door.
locationDescription: In a traffic island where the bus station, port and old town meet.

name: Volcán San Antonio
description: Good geological exhibition, cafe & toilets. Also the place to arrange camel rides.
locationDescription: Just south of Los Canarios (within walking distance).

name: Reserva Marina
fullName: Centro de Interpretación de la Reserva Marina
description: The old lighthouse with attached (not very good) museum.
locationDescription: In the far south of the island.

name: Salinas de Fuencaliente
description: Interesting self-guided tour around family-run salt pans. One of the island's main visitor attractions.
locationDescription: Next to the lighthouses in the far south.

name: Refugio El Pilar
description: A hub for walks in the Cumbre Vieja. Toilets, BBQ pits, play area, campsite, water and a small mobile kiosk selling drinks and snacks.
locationDescription: Where the Cumbre Nueva turns into the Cumbre Vieja along the LP-301.

name: Centro de Visitantes
fullName: Centro de Visitantes Caldera de Taburiente
description: The main visitor centre ideally situated for many walks. Has an exhibition, garden with rare plants, toilets, and a well-informed information desk.
locationDescription: In the middle of the island a little east of El Paso along the LP-3.

name: The Cumbrecita
description: A saddle pint between Pico Bejenado and the Caldera with multiple viewpoints on a short easy circuit.
locationDescription: North of the Centro de Visitantes at the end of the LP-302.

name: Camping Caldera
description: Basic campsite in the heart of the Caldera ideal for exploring. No facilities except toilets and water.
locationDescription: In the heart of the Caldera at the point the PR LP 13 route loops back.

name: Playa de Taburiente
description: Pebble beach-like area at the far end of the Caldera
locationDescription: In the heart of the Caldera at the point the PR LP 13 route loops back.

name: Roque de los Muchachos
description: The highest point on the island at 2307.7m
locationDescription: On the crater rim on the LP-4.

name: Observatorio
fullName: Observatorio del Roque de los Muchachos
description: Collection of some 17 telescopes. Daytime visits and stargazing tours can be arranged.
locationDescription: Just off the crater rim on the other side of Roque de los Muchachos.

name: Refugio Punta de Los Roques
description: La Palma's only functioning hiker hut sleeping 16. No toilets, probably no water.
locationDescription: Alon the Caldera rim at the point the Caldera truns into the Cumbre Nueva.

name: Mirador El Time
description: Popular viewpoint with restaurant/cafe and a couple of tourist shops.
locationDescription: Along the LP-1 as the road climbs out of the north side of the Barranco de las Angustias.

name: Torre del Time
description: Fire watch tower with viewpoint. Better views can be had further down the trail.
locationDescription: West of El Jesus along the barranco edge. A track leads there.

name: Pirate's Bay
description: Timy hamlet officially known as Porís de Candelaria built into a cave setting with a swimming spot.
locationDescription: West of Tijarafe. A track leads down most of the way.

name: Puntagorda Mercadillo
description: Popular local market selling foods and handmade objects. Bar nearby.
locationDescription: North of the El Pinar part of Puntagorda.

name: Miradores flotantes Izcagua
description: Series of daringly cantilivered glass-bottomed miragors overlooking the Barranco de Izcagua.
locationDescription: North of the El Pinar part of Puntagorda next to the mercadillo.

name: Cuevas de Buracas
description: Historic caves with one staging a recreation of how the ancient Guanches may have lived.
locationDescription: North-west of Las Tricias along the GR 130 (variant) path.

name: MIGO
fullName: Molino de Buracas y Museo de Interpretación del Gofio (MIGO)
description: Historic grain mill and attached museum dedicated to gofio, the local roasted grain flour.
locationDescription: North-west of Las tricias along the barranco edge down a drivable track.

name: Los Dragos de Buracas
description: The most impressive dragon tree speciment on the island.
locationDescription: North-west of Las Tricias, Puntagorda, about half way to the Cuevas de Buracas.

name: Mirador de los Dragos
description: Famous leaning dragon tree and secondary miragor further on.
locationDescription: A little south of Puntagorda where the Pista del Roque meets the LP-1.

name: La Zarza
fullName: Parque Cultural La Zarza y La Zarcita
description: Archeological park and museum featuring some of the best preserved petroglyphs created by the aboriginal Guanches. Toilets.
locationDescription: East of Llano Negro, Garafia.

name: Puerto de Garafía
description: Beautiful port at the end of a rich coastal zone, a haven for birds. Ideal for watching the sun go down.
locationDescription: West of Santo Domingo de Garafia down the LP-1141.

name: Barranco de la Madera
description: High narrow gallery path with tunnels, some in poor condition.
locationDescription: North-west of Las Nieves, north of Santa Cruz.

name: Las Nieves
description: Santuario de Nuestra Señora de Las Nieves church and bar/restaurant. Popular place.
locationDescription: North-west of Santa Cruse along the LP-101.

name: Las Fuentes de Las Breñas
description: A series of natural springs (many now waterless), some decorated with small shrines.
locationDescription: In the forest south-west of San Pedro

name: Mirador de la Concepción
description: Crater rim providing exceptional views over Santa Cruz. A slightly unsafe dirt path leads out to a radio mast and on for more views.
locationDescription: About half way between Santa Cruz and San Pedro

name: Los Molinos
description: Historic water-driven sugar mills.
locationDescription: Up the hill in Santa Cruz near Estadio Sylvestre Carrillo.

name: Cascada de Los Colores
description: Man-made waterfall interestingly coloured by minerals and vegetation.
locationDescription: Off a signed side path on the PR LP 13 path in the heart of the Caldera.

name: Puente de Los Tilos
description: Famous bridge which was at one time the highest in Spain.
locationDescription: At the LP-1/LP-105 junction. Within easy walking distance from Los Tilos.
